# Check priors

## Settings
```{r setup, include=FALSE}
source("../src/utils.R")
setup(use_stan=TRUE, is_rmd=TRUE)
```


## Priors

### Normal(0, 10) for alpha and beta
```{r, fig.width=5, fig.height=4}
# priors | Normal(0, 10)
samples = rnorm(1000, mean=0, sd=10)
p = ggplot() +
  geom_histogram(aes(samples), fill="#56B4E9", alpha=0.8) +
  scale_x_continuous(breaks=seq(-100, 100, 10)) +
  labs(title=expression(italic("Samples from Normal(0, 10)")), x="Value", y="Count") +
  NULL
print(p)
```


### Exponential(1) for sigma_u, sigma_Y
```{r, fig.width=5, fig.height=4}
# priors | Exponential(1)
samples = rexp(1000, rate=1)
p = ggplot() +
  geom_histogram(aes(samples), fill="#56B4E9", alpha=0.8) +
  scale_x_continuous(breaks=seq(-100, 100, 1)) +
  labs(title=expression(italic("Samples from Exponential(1)")), x="Value", y="Count") +
  NULL
print(p)
```
